question:

- For every man that passes, Robert has to give $\$1$ to James.

Assuming that it is equally likely to pass a man or a woman, find the probability of James winning the game.

question:
Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & 3z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
2x & - & y & - & z & + & t & = & 0 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{4}t-\frac{7}{12},\frac{3}{4}t-\frac{3}{4},t\bigg)$, for all $t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},-\frac{7}{12},-\frac{3}{4},0\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The solution of the system is the vector of coordinates $(2,-1,0,0)$.

question:

\[
\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
\text{Project} & \text{N. of programmers}  & \text{N. of analysts}  & \text{N. of terminals} \\
\hline
\text{A} & 2 & 2 & 3 \\
\text{B} & 3 & 6 & 1 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]	

The company wants to minimize the cost of developing projects in the next period. In the development of these projects, at least $10$ programmers and $5$ analysts should be used while the company only has $6$ terminals available. How does the Linear Programming (LP) model should be formalized  to allow planning the company's activity?

Consider the vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$, $v_1=(2, 0, 1)$, $v_2=(1, -1, 3)$, $v_3=(1, 1, -2)$ and $v_4=(3, 1, 0)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.
answer2: $v_4$ is a linear combination of $v_1$ and $v_3$
answer3: The space generated by $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer4: $v_3$ is a linear combination of $v_2$ and $v_4$

question: The diagonal of a polygon is:
answer1: A straight line segment whose endpoints are two non-consecutive vertices.
answer2: A straight line segment uniting the median points of two consecutive sides.
answer3: A straight line through two non-consecutive vertices.
answer4: A semi-straight line whose origin is one of the vertices of the polygon and goes through the opposite vertice.

If $u=(1,-2,\lambda)$ and $v=(-2,4,5)$ are linearly dependent vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$, indicate what value can $\lambda$ assume.
Choose the true statement.
answer1: A concave polygon may have a diagonal outside the polygon.
answer2: A convex polygon may have a diagonal outside the polygon.
answer3: The diagonals of a convex polygon are all congruent.
answer4: A diagonal can join two consecutive vertices of the polygon.

question: Choose the set of vectors which is not a spanning set of $\mathbb{R}^2$.
Consider the vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$, $v_1=(2, 0, 1)$, $v_2=(1, -1, 3)$, $v_3=(1, 1, -2)$ and $v_4=(3, 1, 0)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.
answer2: $v_4$ is a linear combination of $v_1$ and $v_3$
answer3: The space generated by $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer4: $v_3$ is a linear combination of $v_2$ and $v_4$

question: Determine the relative extrema of the function $f:(0,\infty)\times(0,\infty)\times (0,\infty)\rightarrow{\mathbb R}$ given by $f(x,y,z)=\displaystyle \frac{1}{x}+\frac{x}{y}+\frac{y}{z}+\frac{z}{16}.$
Consider the linear transformation  $T:\mathbb{R}^3 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^4$ and $T(x,y,z)=(x-y+3z,2x+2y+2z,-x+y-3z,3x+4y+2z)$. Choose the wrong answer.

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
z &- &iw &= &1 \\
iz &- &w &= &1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\bigg(\frac{1-i}{2},\frac{-1+i}{2}\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer3: The system has $(z,-iz)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer4: The system has $\bigg(\frac{1-i}{2},\frac{1+i}{2}\bigg)$ as unique solution.

Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we
apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	
Find the allowable range for the coefficient of $x_{3}$ in the objective function based on the final complete simplex tableau.

Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

Construct the dual problem for the following problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}
\text{Maximize} & Z= 2x_{1} + 7x_{2} + 4x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & x_{1} + 2x_{2} + x_{3}\leq 10\\ 
& 3x_{1}+3x_{2}+2x_{3}\leq 10\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]
answer1:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\geq 4\\
			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 	
			\end{array}
			\]
answer2:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Minimize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\
			\text{subject to} & u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 2\\
			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\leq 7\\
			& u_{1}+2u_{2}\leq 4\\
			&  u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\ 
			\end{array}
			\]
answer3:
\[\begin{array}{ll}
			\text{Maximize} & W=10u_{1}+10u_{2}\\

			& 2u_{1}+3u_{2}\geq 7\\

			& u_{1}, u_{2}\geq 0\\

			\]
answer4:

question: Consider the subsets  $\displaystyle A=\{(1, 1, 1), (0, 1, 1), (1, 2, 3)\}$ and $\displaystyle B=\left\{(1, 1, 1), \left(-\frac{2}{3}, \frac{1}{3}, \frac{1}{3}\right), \left(0, -\frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{2}\right)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $B$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $A$ isn't an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer2: $A$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $B$ isn't an orhtogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer3: $A$ and $B$ are both orthogonal basis of of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer4: $A$ and $B$ are both non-orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
-x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
x &+ &3y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $(x,0,x)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $(1,0,1)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The system has $(0,y,y)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
